member.name: T:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString
member.summary: Represents a string that can be converted to System.String with interning, i.e. by returning an existing string if it has been seen before and is still tracked in the intern table.

member.name: T:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.Enumerator
member.summary: Enumerator for the top-level struct. Enumerates characters of the string.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.Enumerator._string
member.summary: The InternableString being enumerated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.Enumerator._spanIndex
member.summary: Index of the current span, -1 represents the inline span.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.Enumerator._charIndex
member.summary: Index of the current character in the current span, -1 if MoveNext has not been called yet.

member.name: P:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.Enumerator.Current
member.summary: Returns the current character.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.Enumerator.MoveNext
member.summary: Moves to the next character.
member.returns: True if there is another character, false if the enumerator reached the end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString._inlineSpan
member.summary: The span held by this struct, inline to be able to represent . May be empty.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString._spans
member.summary: Additional spans held by this struct. May be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.#ctor(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Constructs a new InternableString wrapping the given .
member.remarks: When wrapping a span representing an entire System.String, use Internable(string) for optimum performance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new InternableString wrapping the given string.
member.param: The string to wrap, must be non-null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.#ctor(Microsoft.NET.StringTools.SpanBasedStringBuilder)
member.summary: Constructs a new InternableString wrapping the given SpanBasedStringBuilder.

member.name: P:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Creates a new enumerator for enumerating characters in this string. Does not allocate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.Equals(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the string is equal to another string by ordinal comparison.
member.returns: True if this string is equal to .

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.ExpensiveConvertToString
member.summary: Returns a System.String representing this string. Allocates memory unless this InternableString was created by wrapping a System.String in which case the original string is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.ReferenceEquals(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if this InternableString wraps a System.String and the same System.String is passed as the argument.
member.returns: True is this instance wraps the given string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.ToString
member.summary: Converts this instance to a System.String while first searching for a match in the intern table.
member.remarks: May allocate depending on whether the string has already been interned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.GetHashCode
member.summary: Implements the simple yet very decently performing djb2-like hash function (xor version) as inspired by https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/6262ae8e6a33abac569ab6086cdccc470c810ea4/src/libraries/System.Private.CoreLib/src/System/String.Comparison.cs#L810-L840
member.returns: A stable hashcode of the string represented by this instance.
member.remarks: Unlike the BCL method, this implementation works only on two characters at a time to cut on the complexity with characters that feed into the same operation but straddle multiple spans. Note that it must return the same value for a given string regardless of how it's split into spans (e.g. { "AB" } and { "A", "B" } have the same hash code).

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.GetHashCodeHelper(System.Char*,System.Int32,System.UInt32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Hashes a memory block specified by a pointer and length.
member.param: True if the incoming was calculated from an odd number of characters.
member.returns: The updated running hash code (not passed as a ref parameter to play nicely with JIT optimizations).

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString.RotateLeft(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rotates an integer by the specified number of bits.

member.name: T:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.SpanBasedStringBuilder
member.summary: A StringBuilder replacement that keeps a list of spans making up the intermediate string rather than a copy of its characters. This has positive impact on both memory (no need to allocate space for the intermediate string) and time (no need to copy characters to the intermediate string).
member.remarks: The method tries to intern the resulting string without even allocating it if it's already interned. Use to take advantage of pooling to eliminate allocation overhead of this class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.SpanBasedStringBuilder.Enumerator
member.summary: Enumerator for the top-level class. Enumerates characters of the string.

member.summary: The spans being enumerated.

member.summary: Returns the current character.

member.summary: Moves to the next character.
member.returns: True if there is another character, false if the enumerator reached the end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.Strings._spanBasedStringBuilder
member.summary: Per-thread instance of the SpanBasedStringBuilder, created lazily.
member.remarks: This field serves as a per-thread one-item object pool, which is adequate for most use cases as the builder is not expected to be held for extended periods of time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.Strings.WeakIntern(System.String)
member.summary: Interns the given string, keeping only a weak reference to the returned value.
member.returns: A string equal to , could be the same object as .
member.remarks: The intern pool does not retain strong references to the strings it's holding so strings are automatically evicted after they become unrooted. This is in contrast to System.String.Intern which holds strings forever.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.Strings.WeakIntern(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Interns the given readonly span of characters, keeping only a weak reference to the returned value.
member.returns: A string equal to , could be the result of calling ToString() on .
member.remarks: The intern pool does not retain strong references to the strings it's holding so strings are automatically evicted after they become unrooted. This is in contrast to System.String.Intern which holds strings forever.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.Strings.GetSpanBasedStringBuilder
member.summary: Returns a new or recycled .
member.remarks: Call on the returned instance to recycle it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.Strings.EnableDiagnostics
member.summary: Enables diagnostics in the interner. Call to retrieve the diagnostic data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.Strings.CreateDiagnosticReport
member.summary: Retrieves the diagnostic data describing the current state of the interner. Make sure to call beforehand.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.Strings.ReturnSpanBasedStringBuilder(Microsoft.NET.StringTools.SpanBasedStringBuilder)
member.summary: Returns a instance back to the pool if possible.

member.name: T:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache
member.summary: Implements the WeakStringCache functionality on modern .NET versions where ConcurrentDictionary is available.

A cache of weak GC handles pointing to strings. Weak GC handles are functionally equivalent to WeakReference's but have less overhead (they're a struct as opposed to WR which is a finalizable class) at the expense of requiring manual lifetime management. As long as a string has an ordinary strong GC root elsewhere in the process and another string with the same hashcode hasn't reused the entry, the cache has a reference to it and can match it to an internable. When the string is collected, it is also automatically "removed" from the cache by becoming unrecoverable from the GC handle. GC handles that do not reference a live string anymore are freed lazily.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache.GetOrCreateEntry(Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Main entrypoint of this cache. Tries to look up a string that matches the given internable. If it succeeds, returns the string and sets cacheHit to true. If the string is not found, calls ExpensiveConvertToString on the internable, adds the resulting string to the cache, and returns it, setting cacheHit to false.
member.param: The internable describing the string we're looking for.
true if match found in cache, false otherwise.
member.returns: A string matching the given internable.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache.Scavenge
member.summary: Iterates over the cache and removes unused GC handles, i.e. handles that don't reference live strings. This is expensive so try to call such that the cost is amortized to O(1) per GetOrCreateEntry() invocation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache.GetDebugInfo
member.summary: Returns internal debug counters calculated based on the current state of the cache.

member.name: T:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache.DebugInfo
member.summary: Debug stats returned by GetDebugInfo().

member.name: T:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache.StringWeakHandle
member.summary: Holds a weak GC handle to a string. Shared by all strings with the same hash code and referencing the last such string we've seen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache.StringWeakHandle.WeakHandle
member.summary: Weak GC handle to the last string of the given hashcode we've seen.

member.name: P:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache.StringWeakHandle.IsUsed
member.summary: Returns true if the string referenced by the handle is still alive.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache.StringWeakHandle.GetString(Microsoft.NET.StringTools.InternableString@)
member.summary: Returns the string referenced by this handle if it is equal to the given internable.
member.param: The internable describing the string we're looking for.
member.returns: The string matching the internable or null if the handle is referencing a collected string or the string is different.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache.StringWeakHandle.SetString(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the handle to the given string. If the handle is still referencing another live string, that string is effectively forgotten.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache.StringWeakHandle.Free
member.summary: Frees the GC handle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache._initialCapacity
member.summary: Initial capacity of the underlying dictionary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache._scavengeThreshold
member.summary: The maximum size we let the collection grow before scavenging unused entries.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache.DisposeImpl
member.summary: Frees all GC handles and clears the cache.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCache.GetDebugInfoImpl
member.summary: Returns internal debug counters calculated based on the current state of the cache.

member.name: T:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCacheInterner
member.summary: Implements interning based on a WeakStringCache.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCacheInterner._weakStringCache
member.summary: The cache to keep strings in.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCacheInterner._regularInternHits
member.summary: Number of times the regular interning path found the string in the cache.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCacheInterner._regularInternMisses

member.summary: Total number of chars eliminated across all strings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.NET.StringTools.WeakStringCacheInterner._internCallCountsByString
member.summary: Maps strings that went though the interning path to the number of times they have been seen. The higher the number the better the payoff of interning. Null if statistics gathering has not been enabled.
